item.title: 欧洲创纪录的股票回购使其成为比美国更优的选择
item.description: 投资者若想寻找买入欧洲股票的新理由，或将其作为优于美国股市的选择，可以将创纪录的股票回购纳入考量。【原文：Investors looking for a fresh reason to buy European stocks, or to choose it over the US, can add record buybacks to their list.】

item.title: Engie Tries to Catch Peers With $14 Billion UK Power Grid Bet
item.description: 在采取谨慎交易策略四年后，法国能源集团Engie SA首席执行官凯瑟琳·麦克格雷戈尔以105亿英镑（142亿美元）收购英国电网，完成了其上任以来最大规模的收购。【原文：After four years of taking a cautious approach to deals, Engie SA Chief Executive Officer Catherine MacGregor made her biggest acquisition yet with a £10.5 billion ($14.2 billion) bet on UK electricity grids.】

item.title: 英镑在补选后成为表现最差的主要货币
瑞银提名前国际清算银行行长卡斯滕斯、苹果公司马斯特里加入董事会
item.description: 瑞银集团任命前国际清算银行行长奥古斯丁·卡斯滕斯和苹果公司副总裁卢卡·马埃斯特里加入其董事会。【原文：UBS Group AG named Agustin Carstens, the former head of the Bank for International Settlements, and Luca Maestri, vice president at Apple Inc., to its board.】

item.title: 抢购韩国芯片股引发全球ETF剧烈波动
item.description: A wave of global money chasing high-flying shares of South Korean chipmakers is spurring abnormal moves and volumes in exchange‑traded funds.

item.title: 双威集团表示，若27亿令吉收购IJM的要约遭拒，将选择退出。
item.description: 双威集团创始人张国荣表示，若建筑商IJM集团的股东未能在4月6日截止期限前接受该集团的收购要约，双威集团将准备撤回收购意向。【原文：Sunway Bhd. is prepared to walk away from its offer to acquire IJM Corp. if the builder’s shareholders do not accept the conglomerate’s deal by the April 6 deadline, said Sunway founder Jeffrey Cheah.】

item.title: 英国债券发行量将降至三年最低水平
item.description: 英国预计将在未来一年大幅削减国债发行规模，这对担忧该国财政紧张状况的债券投资者而言，可谓难得的好消息。【原文：The UK is expected to slash gilt sales in the coming year, a rare piece of good news for bond investors concerned about the country’s strained finances.】

item.title: 美银称人工智能资本支出推动新兴市场创二十年来最强劲盈利表现
item.description: 摩根士丹利指出，新兴市场股票正迎来自2002-04年超级周期以来最强劲的盈利增长期，这主要得益于人工智能投资的激增——该领域正重塑着整个资产类别。【原文：Emerging-market stocks are heading for their strongest stretch of earnings growth since the 2002-04 super-cycle, powered by a surge in artificial-intelligence investment that is reshaping the asset class, according to Morgan Stanley.】

item.title: 肯尼亚通胀意外回落，降息前景增强
item.description: 肯尼亚2月份年度通胀率意外降至4.3%，这为央行进一步降息提供了更多空间。【原文：Kenyan annual inflation unexpectedly eased to 4.3% in February, giving the central bank more scope to continue cutting interest rates.】

item.title: SAP’s New Bonus System Ended Up Rewarding Underperforming Bosses
item.description: 知情人士透露，SAP SE的新奖金制度最终导致表现欠佳的管理层获得奖励，而对基层员工的奖金发放标准却更高，引发这家德国软件公司员工和管理层的强烈抗议。【原文：SAP SE’s new bonus system ended up rewarding underperforming managers while holding lower-ranking workers to a higher standard for their payouts, prompting an outcry from employees and leaders alike at the German software company, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 加拿大Fairfax公司有望创纪录地收购印度银行的外国股权
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Fairfax Financial Holdings Ltd.正处于收购IDBI银行有限公司多数股权的领先地位，这可能成为印度银行业迄今为止规模最大的外资投资。该银行股价应声上涨。【原文：Fairfax Financial Holdings Ltd. is the frontrunner to buy a majority stake in IDBI Bank Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter, in what could be the biggest foreign investment in India’s banking sector. Shares rose.】

item.title: Kenya Revives Railway to Nowhere, This Time Without China Loans
item.description: 肯尼亚将于下月重启一条由中国支持的铁路建设项目，该项目因资金枯竭已搁置近七年——此次建设将不再向北京寻求新贷款。【原文：Kenya next month will resume construction of a Chinese-backed railway it abandoned almost seven years ago after funding dried up — this time without taking new loans from Beijing.】

item.title: 谷歌就地图数据请求获首尔有条件批准
item.description: 韩国表示将有条件批准谷歌将高精度地图数据转移至海外的申请，这标志着在数字主权与国家安全问题上持续多年的政策争端出现重大转变。【原文：South Korea said it will grant conditional approval to Google’s request to transfer high-precision map data overseas, marking a significant shift in a long-running policy dispute over digital sovereignty and national security.】

item.title: 波兰计划禁止儿童使用社交媒体，挑战美国科技巨头
item.description: 波兰正推进一项新立法，拟禁止15岁以下儿童使用社交媒体，此举可能引发与美国多家科技巨头的潜在对抗。【原文：Poland is moving ahead with a new legislation that would ban social media for children under 15 years old, setting the stage for a potential battle with some of the biggest US tech companies.】

item.title: 香港动用美元储备金的意外之举引发担忧
item.description: Hong Kong’s proposal to pull HK$150 billion ($19 billion) from a fund used to defend the currency’s peg with the greenback shocked some officials and raised concern over the precedent it sets.

item.title: 习近平的人工智能雄心与脆弱就业市场相冲突
item.description: 就在后空翻人工智能人形机器人与舞者同台献艺惊艳中国新年表演数日后，一家小型研究公司突然向美国市场发出严正警告：自动化技术可能通过取代工人引发经济螺旋式下滑。【原文：Days after back-flipping AI humanoids dazzled China with a new year performance alongside dancers, a small research firm jolted US markets with a stark warning about how automation could trigger an economic spiral by displacing workers.】

item.title: 美元走弱，中国受益于美国关税动荡：市场脉搏
item.description: 最新市场脉搏调查结果显示，在近期关税消息的密集冲击下，美元似乎将成为最大输家之一，而中国股市则有望表现优异。【原文：The dollar looks set to emerge as one of the biggest losers from the latest barrage of tariff news, while China stocks are poised to outperform, according to the results of the latest Markets Pulse survey.】

item.title: 路透社称任天堂计划出售价值19亿美元股份
item.description: 路透社援引三位知情人士的消息报道，任天堂公司计划削减其合作银行持有的价值约3000亿日元（19亿美元）的战略股权。【原文：Nintendo Co. plans to trim strategic shareholdings worth about ¥300 billion ($1.9 billion) owned by its partner banks, Reuters reported, citing three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 亚洲碳交易快讯：韩国碳排放配额价格创三年新高
item.description: 韩国碳排放配额价格攀升至2023年4月以来的最高水平，因投资者对政策调整后供需平衡趋紧的预期推高了价格。【原文：South Korean carbon permit prices climbed to the highest level since April 2023 as investors priced in a tightening demand and supply balance following policy changes.】

item.title: 据称字节跳动支持的东策迪正考虑在香港上市
item.description: 据知情人士透露，汽车信息与交易平台DCar的运营方北京东车地科技有限公司正考虑最早于今年在香港进行首次公开募股。【原文：Beijing Dongchedi Technology Co., an automotive information and trading platform known as DCar, is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong as soon as this year, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 韩国1万亿美元养老基金在KOSPI指数上涨中创下历史最高收益
item.description: 韩国国民年金服务局——全球规模最大的公共养老金基金之一——在2025年创下有史以来最强的年度回报率，这得益于半导体和人工智能驱动的股市上涨推动了其业绩表现。【原文：South Korea’s National Pension Service, one of the world’s largest public pension funds, posted its strongest-ever annual return in 2025 as a semiconductor- and artificial intelligence–driven stock rally boosted performance.】

item.title: 日本两年期国债发售平淡收场，市场持续猜测日本央行动向
item.description: 日本两年期国债拍卖顺利完成，投资者正审视日本央行的加息路径。【原文：Japan’s two-year government bond auction passed through smoothly as investors mull the Bank of Japan’s rate-hike path.】

item.title: 美联储与美国检察官就传票问题仍陷僵局
item.description: 美联储与联邦检察官的对峙仍在持续，后者要求提供有关该央行华盛顿总部两栋历史建筑翻修工程的相关信息。【原文：The Federal Reserve remains in a standoff with a federal prosecutor demanding information related to the renovations of two historic buildings at the central bank’s headquarters in Washington.】

item.title: 人民币交易员加码期权押注，目标锁定5%收益
item.description: 外汇期权市场中押注人民币走强的交易正在增加，交易员们正布局年底前人民币兑美元汇率将升至6.50的走势。【原文：Bets on a stronger yuan are picking up in currency-option markets, with traders positioning for a move toward 6.50 per dollar by year end.】

item.title: 日本芯片制造商Rapidus获16亿美元政府资金
item.description: 日本政府将向国有企业Rapidus公司注资2500亿日元（约合16亿美元），此举是首相高市早苗推动国内芯片制造发展的承诺之一。【原文：The Japanese government will invest a total of ¥250 billion ($1.6 billion) in state-backed Rapidus Corp. as part of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s pledge to boost domestic chipmaking.】

item.title: 双威医疗寻求通过马来西亚IPO筹集7.34亿美元
item.description: 马来西亚双威医疗控股有限公司已开始接受投资者认购其首次公开募股（IPO）的订单，计划筹集28.6亿林吉特（7.34亿美元），这可能是该国九年来规模最大的上市交易。【原文：Malaysia’s Sunway Healthcare Holdings Bhd. has started taking investor orders for an initial public offering that seeks to raise 2.86 billion ringgit ($734 million), in what may be the country’s biggest listing in nine years.】

item.title: 晨星公司称，无需裁员即可释放人工智能的潜力
item.description: 晨星公司指出，企业越来越多地将人工智能作为裁员和削减成本的借口，而非利用该技术通过重新部署员工来提高生产力。【原文：Companies are increasingly using artificial intelligence as justification for cutting headcount and trimming costs, rather than using the technology to boost productivity by redeploying workers, according to Morningstar Inc.】

item.title: 中国科技股或创2024年以来最差月度表现，财报季来袭
item.description: 香港中资科技股正面临两年来的最差月度表现，受企业盈利疲软及内地投资者买盘不足拖累。【原文：Chinese technology stocks in Hong Kong are poised for their worst month in two years, weighed by weak earnings and a lack of buying by mainland investors.】

item.title: 随着盈利增长和估值回落，全球资金重返印度股市
item.description: 二月份，外国投资者购入价值逾25亿美元的股票。【原文：Foreigners have bought over $2.5 billion worth of shares in February.】

item.title: 普拉达暗示奢侈品行业复苏，中国市场趋于稳定
item.description: 随着亚洲财报发布节奏放缓，普拉达公司或将为奢侈品行业在经历艰难的2025年后复苏提供信号。【原文：As the pace of earnings reports in Asia slows, Prada SpA could hint at signs for a recovery in the luxury business after a challenging 2025.】
